settinggroup.name: onlineoffline
settinggroup.title: Board Online / Offline
settinggroup.description: These settings allow you to globally turn your forums online or offline, and allow you to specify a reason for turning them off.

setting.name: boardclosed
setting.title: Board Closed
setting.description: If you need to close your forums to make some changes or perform an upgrade, this is the global switch. Viewers will not be able to view your forums, however, they will see a message with the reason you specify below. Administrators will still be able to view the forums.

setting.name: boardclosed_reason
setting.title: Board Closed Reason
setting.description: If your forum is closed, you can set a message here that your visitors will be able to see when they visit your forums. You can leave this empty to use the language files.
setting.settingvalue: These forums are currently closed for maintenance. Please check back later.

settinggroup.name: details
settinggroup.title: Site Details
settinggroup.description: This section contains various settings such as your board name and url, as well as your website name and url.

setting.name: bbname
setting.title: Board Name
setting.description: The name of your community. We recommend that it is not over 75 characters.

setting.name: bburl
setting.title: Board URL
setting.description:
The url to your forums.
Include the http://. Do NOT include a trailing slash.

setting.name: homename
setting.title: Homepage Name
setting.description: The name of your homepage. This will appear in the footer with a link to it.

setting.name: homeurl
setting.title: Homepage URL
setting.description: The full URL of your homepage. This will be linked to in the footer along with its name.

setting.name: adminemail
setting.title: Admin Email
setting.description: The administrator's email address. This will be used for outgoing emails sent via the forums.

setting.name: returnemail
setting.title: Return Email
setting.description: The email address for incoming replies to outgoing emails sent via the forums and is useful for no-reply accounts. Leave blank to use the admin email address instead.

setting.name: contactemail
setting.title: Contact Email
setting.description: The email address that messages sent via the contact form (contact.php) will be sent to. Leave blank to use the admin email address instead.

setting.name: contactlink
setting.title: Contact Us Link
setting.description: This will be used for the Contact Us link on the bottom of all the forum pages. Can either be an email address (using mailto:email@website.com) or a hyperlink.

setting.name: cookiedomain
setting.title: Cookie Domain
setting.description: The domain which cookies should be set to. This can remain blank. It should also start with a . so it covers all subdomains.

setting.name: cookiepath
setting.title: Cookie Path
setting.description: The path which cookies are set to. We recommend setting this to the full directory path to your forums with a trailing slash.

setting.name: cookieprefix
setting.title: Cookie Prefix
setting.description: A prefix to append to all cookies set by MyBB. This is useful if you wish to install multiple copies of MyBB on the one domain or have other software installed which conflicts with the names of the cookies in MyBB. If not specified, no prefix will be used.

setting.name: cookiesamesiteflag
setting.title: SameSite Cookie Flag
setting.description: Authentication cookies will carry the SameSite flag to prevent CSRF attacks. Keep this disabled if you expect cross-origin POST requests.

setting.name: cookiesecureflag
setting.title: Secure Cookie Flag
setting.description: Cookies can be set with the Secure flag to prevent them from being sent over unencrypted connections. You should enable this setting only if your forum works correctly under HTTPS.

setting.name: showvernum
setting.title: Show Version Numbers
setting.description: Allows you to turn off the public display of version numbers in MyBB.

setting.name: mailingaddress
setting.title: Mailing Address
setting.description: If you have a mailing address, enter it here. This is shown on the COPPA compliance form.

setting.name: faxno
setting.title: Contact Fax No
setting.description: If you have a fax number, enter it here. This is shown on the COPPA compliance form.

settinggroup.name: general
settinggroup.title: General Configuration
settinggroup.description: This section allows you to manage the general aspects of your board.

setting.name: bblanguage
setting.title: Default Language
setting.description: The default language that MyBB should use for guests and for users without a selected language in their user control panel.

setting.name: captchaimage
setting.title: CAPTCHA Images for Registration & Posting
setting.description: To help prevent automated registrations and postings, you can choose a type of image verification for the user to complete. Please see the MyBB Docs for more information on CAPTCHAs.
setting.optionscode: select 0=No CAPTCHA 1=MyBB Default CAPTCHA 4=NoCAPTCHA reCAPTCHA 5=reCAPTCHA invisible

setting.name: captchapublickey
setting.title: reCAPTCHA Public Key
setting.description: Your reCAPTCHA public key.

setting.name: captchaprivatekey
setting.title: reCAPTCHA Private Key
setting.description: Your reCAPTCHA private key.

setting.name: reportmethod
setting.title: Reported Content Notification Method
setting.description: Please select from the list how you would like moderators to be notified when content is reported. Note: Moderators are only notified for posts in forums they moderate or all content if they are a super moderator.
setting.optionscode: radio db=Shown in the Mod CP only pms=Sent as Private Messages and shown in the Mod CP email=Sent via Email and shown in the Mod CP

setting.name: decpoint
setting.title: Decimal Point
setting.description: The decimal point you use in your region.

setting.name: thousandssep
setting.title: Thousands Numeric Separator
setting.description: The punctuation you want to use. For example, a setting of ',' with the number 1200 will give you 1,200.

setting.name: showlanguageselect
setting.title: Show Language Selector in Footer
setting.description: Set to No if you do not want to show the language selection area in the footer of all pages in the board. If you only have one language installed this setting will be ignored.

setting.name: showthemeselect
setting.title: Show Theme Selector in Footer
setting.description: Set to No if you do not want to show the theme selection area in the footer of all pages in the board.

setting.name: maxmultipagelinks
setting.title: Maximum Page Links in Pagination
setting.description: Here you can set the number of next and previous page links to show in the pagination for threads or forums with more than one page of results. Set to 0 to disable the limitation.

setting.name: jumptopagemultipage
setting.title: Show Jump To Page form in Pagination
setting.description: Do you want to show a "jump to page" form in pagination if number of pages exceeds "Maximum Page Links in Pagination"?

setting.name: no_plugins
setting.title: Disable All Plugins
setting.description: Setting this to Yes will disable all plugins without deactivating or uninstalling them. This is equivalent of manually defining NO_PLUGINS at the top of ./inc/init.php.

setting.name: deleteinvites
setting.title: Expire Old Group Invites
setting.description: The number of days until any pending invites to user groups expire. Set to 0 to disable.

setting.name: redirects
setting.title: Friendly Redirection Pages
setting.description: This will enable friendly redirection pages instead of bumping the user directly to the page.

setting.name: enableforumjump
setting.title: Enable Forum Jump Menu?
setting.description: The forum jump menu is shown on the forum and thread view pages. It can add significant load to your forums if you have a large amount of forums. Set to 'No' to disable it.

settinggroup.name: server
settinggroup.title: Server and Optimization Options
settinggroup.description: These options allow you to set various server and optimization preferences allowing you to reduce the load on your server, and gain better performance on your board.

setting.name: seourls
setting.title: Enable search engine friendly URLs?
setting.description: Search engine friendly URLs change the MyBB links to shorter URLs which search engines prefer and are easier to type. showthread.php?tid=1 becomes thread-1.html. Once this setting is enabled you need to make sure you have the MyBB .htaccess in your MyBB root directory (or the equivalent for your web server). Automatic detection may not work on all servers. Please see the MyBB Docs for assistance.

setting.name: seourls_archive
setting.title: Enable search engine friendly URLs in Archive?
setting.description: Search engine friendly URLs can be used in the archive. Once this setting is enabled ensure the archive still works as expected.

setting.name: gzipoutput
setting.title: Use GZip Page Compression?
setting.description: Do you want to compress pages in GZip format when they are sent to the browser? This means quicker downloads for your visitors, and less traffic usage for you.

setting.name: gziplevel
setting.title: GZip Page Compression Level
setting.description: Set the level for GZip Page Compression from 0-9. (0=no compression, 9=maximum compression). A level of 4 is recommended for most installations.

setting.name: nocacheheaders
setting.title: Send No Cache Headers
setting.description: With this option you can enforce dynamic pages to be re-validated by browsers and not cached by proxies.

setting.name: load
setting.title: *NIX Load Limiting
setting.description: Limit the maximum server load before MyBB rejects people. 0 for none. Recommended limit is 5.0.

setting.name: tplhtmlcomments
setting.title: Output template start/end comments?
setting.description: This will enable or disable the output of template start/end comments in the HTML.

setting.name: use_xmlhttprequest
setting.title: Enable XMLHttp request features?
setting.description: This will enable or disable the XMLHttp request features.

setting.name: extraadmininfo
setting.title: Advanced Stats / Debug information
setting.description: Shows Server load, generation time, memory usage, etc on the bottom of all pages in the root folder. Please note that only administrators see this information.

setting.name: uploadspath
setting.title: Uploads Path
setting.description: The path used for all board uploads. It must be chmod 777 (on *nix servers).

setting.name: useerrorhandling
setting.title: Use Error Handling
setting.description: If you do not wish to use the integrated error handling for MyBB, you may turn this option off. However, it is recommended that it stay on

setting.name: errorlogmedium
setting.title: Error Logging Medium
setting.description: The type of the error handling to use.
setting.optionscode: select none=Neither log=Log errors email=Email errors both=Log and email errors

setting.name: errortypemedium
setting.title: Error Type Medium
setting.description: The type of errors to show. It is recommended you hide errors and warnings on a production forum and log them instead.
setting.optionscode: select warning=Warnings error=Errors both=Warnings and Errors none=Hide Errors and Warnings

setting.name: errorloglocation
setting.title: Error Logging Location
setting.description: The location of the log to send errors to, if specified.

setting.name: ip_forwarded_check
setting.title: Scrutinize User's IP address?
setting.description: Do you want to check a user's IP address for HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR or HTTP_X_REAL_IP headers? If you're unsure, set this to No.

setting.name: minifycss
setting.title: Minify Stylesheets?
setting.description: Do you want to minify stylesheets? Choosing Yes can save bandwidth and overall provide faster page loads.

setting.name: usecdn
setting.title: Use a CDN?
setting.description: You can utilise a CDN (Content Delivery Network) to offload the loading of static files such as Stylesheets, JavaScript and Images. Do you wish to enable this functionality?

setting.name: cdnurl
setting.title: URL to use for static files
setting.description: If you have enabled the CDN option above, please enter the base URL to serve static content from. This should be a valid URL without a trailing slash.

setting.name: cdnpath
setting.title: Path to store static files
setting.description: If you have enabled the CDN option above, please optionally enter a full path to store static files. This is only useful for "Push" type CDNs or local sub-domain setups. This path should not have a trailing slash.

settinggroup.name: datetime
settinggroup.title: Date and Time Formats
settinggroup.description: Here you can specify the different date and time formats used to display dates and times on the forums.

setting.name: dateformat
setting.title: Date Format
setting.description: The format of the dates used on the forum. This format uses the PHP date() function. We recommend not changing this unless you know what you're doing.

setting.name: timeformat
setting.title: Time Format
setting.description: The format of the times used on the forum. This format uses PHP's date() function. We recommend not changing this unless you know what you're doing.

setting.name: datetimesep
setting.title: Date/Time Separator
setting.description: Where MyBB joins date and time formats this setting is used to separate them (typically a space or comma).

setting.name: regdateformat
setting.title: Registered Date Format
setting.description: The format used on showthread where it shows when the user registered.

setting.name: timezoneoffset

setting.description: Here you can set the default timezone offset for guests and members using the default offset.

setting.name: dstcorrection
setting.title: Day Light Savings Time
setting.description: If times are an hour out above and your timezone is selected correctly, enable day light savings time correction.

settinggroup.name: forumhome
settinggroup.title: Forum Home Options
settinggroup.description: This section allows you to manage the various settings used on the forum home (index.php) of your boards such as enabling and disabling different features.

setting.name: showdescriptions
setting.title: Show Forum Descriptions?
setting.description: This option will allow you to turn off showing the descriptions for forums.

setting.name: subforumsindex
setting.title: Subforums to show on Index listing
setting.description: The number of subforums that you wish to show inside forums on the index and forumdisplay pages. Set to 0 to not show the subforum list

setting.name: subforumsstatusicons
setting.title: Show Subforum Status Icons?
setting.description: Show icons indicating whether or not a subforum contains new posts or not? This won't have any effect unless you enabled subforums display on the index.

setting.name: hideprivateforums
setting.title: Hide Private Forums?
setting.description: You can hide private forums by turning this option on. This option also hides forums on the forum jump and all subforums.

setting.name: modlist
setting.title: Forums' Moderator Listing
setting.description: Here you can turn on or off the listing of moderators for each forum on index.php and forumdisplay.php

setting.name: showbirthdays
setting.title: Show Today's Birthdays?
setting.description: Do you want to show today's birthdays on the forum homepage?

setting.name: showbirthdayspostlimit
setting.title: Only Show Birthdays with x Posts
setting.description: You can choose to only display users with at least the following amount of posts. A setting of 0 will show all users who have a birthday today.

setting.name: showwol
setting.title: Show Who's Online?
setting.description: Display the currently active users on the forum home page.

setting.name: showindexstats
setting.title: Show Small Stats Section
setting.description: Do you want to show the total number of threads, posts, members, and the last member on the forum home?

setting.name: showforumviewing
setting.title: Show x viewing forum
setting.description: Displays the currently active users viewing each forum.

settinggroup.name: forumdisplay
settinggroup.title: Forum Display Options
settinggroup.description: This section allows you to manage the various settings used on the forum display (forumdisplay.php) of your boards such as enabling and disabling different features.

setting.name: threadsperpage
setting.title: Threads Per Page
setting.description: The number of threads to display per page on the forum display.

setting.name: hottopic
setting.title: Replies For Hot Topic
setting.description: The number of replies that is needed for a topic to be considered 'hot'.

setting.name: hottopicviews
setting.title: Views For Hot Topic
setting.description: The number of views a thread can have before it is considered 'hot'.

setting.name: usertppoptions
setting.title: User Selectable Threads Per Page
setting.description: If you would like to allow users to select how many threads per page are shown in a forum, enter the options they should be able to select separated with commas. If this is left blank they will not be able to choose how many threads are shown per page.

setting.name: dotfolders
setting.title: Use 'dot' Icons
setting.description: Do you want to show dots on the thread indicators of threads users have participated in.

setting.name: allowthreadratings
setting.title: Use Thread Ratings?
setting.description: Allow users to rate threads?

setting.name: browsingthisforum
setting.title: Users Browsing this Forum
setting.description: Here you can turn off the 'users browsing this forum' feature.

setting.name: announcementlimit
setting.title: Announcements Limit
setting.description: The number of forum announcements to show in the thread listing on the forum display pages. Set to 0 to disable announcements altogether.

setting.name: readparentforums
setting.title: Attempt to Mark Parent Forums as Read
setting.description: When set to Yes, this setting will attempt to mark the parent forums of a sub-forum as read if there are no more unread posts. Please note that this setting can lead to a decrease in performance and multiple database queries and therefore must be treated as experimental. See the MyBB Docs for more information regarding this change.

settinggroup.name: showthread
settinggroup.title: Show Thread Options
settinggroup.description: This section allows you to manage the various settings used on the thread display page (showthread.php) of your boards such as enabling and disabling different features.

setting.name: postlayout
setting.title: Post Layout
setting.description: Allows you to switch between the classic and new horizontal layout modes. Classic mode shows the author information to the left of the post, horizontal shows the author information above the post.
setting.optionscode: radio horizontal=Display posts using the horizontal post layout classic=Display posts using the classic layout

setting.name: postsperpage
setting.title: Posts Per Page:
setting.description: The number of posts to display per page. We recommend its not higher than 20 for people with slower connections.

setting.name: userpppoptions
setting.title: User Selectable Posts Per Page
setting.description: If you would like to allow users to select how many posts are shown per page in a thread, enter the options they should be able to select separated with commas. If this is left blank they will not be able to choose how many posts are shown per page.

setting.name: postmaxavatarsize
setting.title: Maximum Avatar Dimensions in Posts
setting.description: The maximum dimensions for avatars when being displayed in a post (width and height separated by 'x' or '|') . If an avatar is too large, it will automatically be scaled down.

setting.name: threadreadcut
setting.title: Read Threads in Database (Days)
setting.description: The number of days that you wish to keep thread read information in the database. For large boards, we do not recommend a high number as the board will become slower. Set to 0 to disable.

setting.name: threadusenetstyle
setting.title: Usenet Style Thread View
setting.description: Selecting Yes will cause posts to look similar to how posts look in USENET. No will cause posts to look the modern way.

setting.name: quickreply
setting.title: Show Quick Reply Form
setting.description: Allows you to set whether or not the quick reply form will be shown at the bottom of threads.

setting.name: multiquote
setting.title: Show Multi-quote Buttons
setting.description: The multi-quote button allows users to select a series of posts then click Reply and have those posts quoted in their message.

setting.name: showsimilarthreads
setting.title: Show 'Similar Threads' Table
setting.description: The Similar Threads table shows threads that are relevant to the thread being read. You can set the relevancy below.

setting.name: similarityrating
setting.title: Similar Threads Relevancy Rating
setting.description: This allows you to limit similar threads to ones more relevant (0 being not relevant). This number should not be over 10 and should not be set low (<5) for large forums. Does not apply to PgSQL databases.

setting.name: similarlimit
setting.title: Similar Threads Limit
setting.description: Here you can change the total amount of similar threads to be shown in the similar threads table. It is recommended that it is not over 15 for 56k users.

setting.name: showforumpagesbreadcrumb
setting.title: Show Forum Multipage Dropdown
setting.description: If the forum has more than 1 page of threads, do you want to display a dropdown pagination menu in the breadcrumbs?

setting.name: browsingthisthread
setting.title: Users Browsing this Thread
setting.description: Here you can turn off the 'users browsing this thread' feature.

setting.name: delayedthreadviews
setting.title: Delayed Thread View Updates
setting.description: If this setting is enabled, the number of thread views for threads will be updated in the background by the task schedule system. If not enabled, thread view counters are incremented instantly.

settinggroup.name: member
settinggroup.title: Login and Registration Options
settinggroup.description: Here you can control various settings with relation to user account registration and login management.

setting.name: disableregs
setting.title: Disable Registrations
setting.description: Allows you to turn off the capability for users to register with one click.

setting.name: regtype
setting.title: Registration Method
setting.description: Please select the method of registration to use when users register.
setting.optionscode: select instant=Instant Activation verify=Send Email Verification randompass=Send Random Password admin=Administrator Activation both=Email Verification & Administrator Activation

setting.name: awactialert
setting.title: Awaiting Activation Notification
setting.description: Do you want to show a notification to administrators about accounts awaiting activation?

setting.name: forcelogin
setting.title: Force Users to Login
setting.description: Setting this to Yes will force guests to login or register in order to access the board.

setting.name: minnamelength
setting.title: Minimum Username Length
setting.description: The minimum number of characters a username can be when a user registers.

setting.name: securityquestion

setting.description: If the user does not set a custom avatar this image will be used instead. If you want to use a different image for different themes, please use {theme} to represent the image directory of each theme.

setting.name: useravatardims
setting.title: Default Avatar Dimensions
setting.description: The dimensions of the default avatar; width and height separated by 'x' or '|' (e.g. 40|40 or 40x40).

setting.description:
Allows you to set the maximum rating for Gravatars if a user chooses to use one. If a user avatar is higher than this rating a default avatar will be used. The ratings are:
  • G: suitable for display on all websites with any audience type
  • PG: may contain rude gestures, provocatively dressed individuals, the lesser swear words or mild violence
  • R: may contain such things as harsh profanity, intense violence, nudity or hard drug use
  • X: may contain hardcore sexual imagery or extremely disturbing violence

setting.name: customtitlemaxlength

setting.name: allowbuddyonly

settinggroup.name: posting

setting.name: minmessagelength
setting.title: Minimum Message Length
setting.description: The minimum number of characters to post.

setting.name: maxmessagelength
setting.title: Maximum Message Length
setting.description:
The maximum number of characters (bytes) to allow in a message. Set 0 to allow maximum length permitted as per your database.
Tip: MySQL users (max: 65535) can change message field type manually from TEXT to MEDIUMTEXT (16777215) or LONGTEXT (4294967295) to obtain enhanced limit.

setting.name: mycodemessagelength
setting.title: MyCode Affects Minimum Message Length?
setting.description: Do you want MyCode to be counted as part of the minimum limit when users use MyCode in messages?

setting.name: postfloodcheck

setting.name: postmergemins

setting.name: postmergefignore
setting.title: Merge Forums to Ignore
setting.description: Forums to exclude from the auto merge feature. Leave blank to disable.

setting.name: postmergeuignore
setting.title: Merge User Groups to Ignore

setting.name: postmergesep

setting.description: The Separator to be used when merging two message Default: '[hr]'

setting.name: showeditedby
setting.title: Show 'edited by' Messages
setting.description: Once a post is edited by a regular user, do you want to show the edited by message?

setting.name: showeditedbyadmin
setting.title: Show 'edited by' Message for Administrators and Moderators
setting.description: Do you want to show edited by messages for posts created by administrators and moderators?

setting.name: maxpostimages
setting.title: Maximum Images per Post
setting.description: Enter the maximum number of images (including smilies) a user can put in their post. Set to 0 to disable this.

setting.name: maxpostvideos

setting.description: How many characters of the post do you want to send with the email notification of a new reply?

setting.description: The maximum depth level for quote tags. When quote-replying to a post, all nested quotes which exceed this threshold are automatically removed. Note that this value is only enforced when quote-replying - it is still possible to manually enter quotes to exceed this limit, and this setting will not affect posts already submitted. Set to 0 to disable.

setting.name: polloptionlimit
setting.title: Maximum Poll Option Length

setting.name: maxpolloptions
setting.title: Maximum Number of Poll Options

setting.name: polltimelimit

setting.name: threadreview

setting.name: enablecalendar

setting.description: If you wish to disable the calendar on your board, set this option to No.

setting.title: Max Number of Login Attempts
setting.description: The max number of attempts to login before being locked out. Set to 0 to disable.

setting.name: loginattemptstimeout
setting.title: Login Attempts Timeout
setting.description: If the person trying to login reaches the max number of attempts, how long should they have to wait before being able to login again (in minutes)? Set to 0 to disable.

settinggroup.name: mailsettings
settinggroup.title: Mail Settings
settinggroup.description: This section allows you to control various aspects of the MyBB mail system, such as sending with PHP mail or with a off server SMTP server.

setting.name: mail_handler
setting.title: Mail handler
setting.description: The medium through which MyBB will send outgoing emails.

setting.name: smtp_host
setting.title: SMTP hostname
setting.description:
The hostname of the SMTP server through which mail should be sent.
Only required if SMTP Mail is selected as the Mail Handler.

setting.name: smtp_port
setting.title: SMTP port
setting.description:
The port number of the SMTP server through which mail should be sent.
Only required if SMTP Mail is selected as the Mail Handler.

setting.name: smtp_user
setting.title: SMTP username
setting.description:
The username used to authenticate with the SMTP server.
Only required if SMTP Mail is selected as the Mail Handler, and the SMTP server requires authentication.

setting.name: smtp_pass
setting.title: SMTP password
setting.description:
The corresponding password used to authenticate with the SMTP server.
Only required if SMTP Mail is selected as the Mail Handler, and the SMTP server requires authentication.

setting.name: secure_smtp
setting.title: SMTP Encryption Mode
setting.description:
Select the encryption required to communicate with the SMTP server.
Only required if SMTP Mail is selected as the Mail Handler.

setting.name: mail_parameters
setting.title: Additional Parameters for PHP's mail()
setting.description: This setting allows you to set additional parameters for the PHP mail() function. Only used when 'PHP mail' is selected as Mail Handler. More information

setting.name: mail_logging
setting.title: Mail Logging
setting.description: This setting allows you to set how to log outgoing emails sent via the 'Send Thread to a Friend' feature. In some countries it is illegal to log all content.
setting.optionscode: select 0=Disable email logging 1=Log emails without content 2=Log everything

setting.name: mail_message_id
setting.title: Add message ID in mail headers
setting.description: Disabling this option on some shared hosts resolves issues with forum emails being marked as spam.

settinggroup.name: contactsettings
settinggroup.title: Contact Settings
settinggroup.description: The various options to change the behaviour of the contact page (contact.php).

setting.name: contact
setting.title: Enable Contact Page
setting.description: Setting this to Yes will allow access to the contact page.

setting.name: contact_guests
setting.title: Disable Contact Page to Guests
setting.description: Setting this to Yes will disallow access to the contact page for guests.

setting.name: contact_badwords
setting.title: Enable Word Filter on Contact Page
setting.description: Setting this to Yes will will send the subject and message fields through the word filter before sending.

setting.name: contact_maxsubjectlength
setting.title: Maximum Subject Length on Contact Page
setting.description: The maximum number of characters (bytes) to allow in the subject. A setting of 0 allows an unlimited length.

setting.name: contact_minmessagelength
setting.title: Minimum Message Length on Contact Page
setting.description: The minimum number of characters in order to send the message. A value of 0 disables this setting.

setting.name: contact_maxmessagelength
setting.title: Maximum Message Length on Contact Page
setting.description: The maximum number of characters (bytes) to allow in the message. A setting of 0 allows an unlimited length.

settinggroup.name: purgespammer
settinggroup.title: Purge Spammer
settinggroup.description: This section allows you to change the settings of the Purge Spammer feature.

setting.name: purgespammergroups
setting.title: Allowed Usergroups
setting.description: Select the usergroups which should be allowed to use Purge Spammer.

setting.name: purgespammerpostlimit
setting.title: Post Limit
setting.description: This setting stops this tool being used on users who have more than a certain amount of posts, to prevent it being used on active members. Setting the value to 0 will disable the post check, however this is not recommended.

setting.name: purgespammerbandelete
setting.title: Ban or Delete Spammers
setting.description: Do you want to ban or delete spammers with this tool?

setting.name: purgespammerbangroup
setting.title: Ban Usergroup
setting.description: Choose the usergroup to put users into when they get purged. Defaults to the fundamental Banned usergroup.

setting.name: purgespammerbanreason
setting.title: Ban Reason
setting.description: The reason which is used to ban the spammer.

setting.name: purgespammerapikey
setting.title: Stop Forum Spam API Key
setting.description: In order to be able to submit information on a spammer to the Stop Forum Spam database, you need an API key. You can get one of these here. When you have your key, paste it into the box below.

settinggroup.name: stopforumspam
settinggroup.title: Stop Forum Spam
settinggroup.description: This section allows you to change the settings used for the integration with StopForumSpam.com

setting.name: enablestopforumspam_on_register
setting.title: Check Registrations Against StopForumSpam.com?
setting.description: Do you wish to check all new registrations against the StopForumSpam.com database?

setting.name: stopforumspam_on_contact
setting.title: Check Guest Contact Submissions Against StopForumSpam?
setting.description: Should guest email and IP addresses be checked against StopForumSpam when using the contact page?

setting.name: stopforumspam_on_newreply
setting.title: Check Guest Replies Against StopForumSpam?
setting.description: Should guest usernames and IP addresses be checked against StopForumSpam when creating new replies?

setting.name: stopforumspam_on_newthread
setting.title: Check Guest Threads Against StopForumSpam?
setting.description: Should guest usernames and IP addresses be checked against StopForumSpam when creating new threads?

setting.name: stopforumspam_min_weighting_before_spam
setting.title: Minimum stop forum spam weighting?
setting.description: The minimum weighting received from StopForumSpam before deciding a user is a spammer. Should be a number between 0 and 100.

setting.name: stopforumspam_check_usernames
setting.title: Check usernames?
setting.description: Should the user usernames be checked against the StopForumSpam database?

setting.name: stopforumspam_check_emails
setting.title: Check email addresses?
setting.description: Should the user email addresses be checked against the StopForumSpam database?

setting.name: stopforumspam_check_ips
setting.title: Check IP addresses?
setting.description: Should the user IP addresses be checked against the StopForumSpam database?

setting.name: stopforumspam_block_on_error
setting.title: Block on StopForumSpam error?
setting.description: If there is an error retrieving information from the StopForumSpam API, should the user be blocked?

setting.name: stopforumspam_log_blocks
setting.title: Log StopForumSpam blocks?
setting.description: Should every StopForumSpam block be logged?

settinggroup.name: contactdetails
settinggroup.title: Contact Details
settinggroup.description: This section allows you to change the settings of the contact fields feature.

setting.name: allowicqfield
setting.title: Allow ICQ Number Field To Usergroups
setting.description: Select the usergroups which should be allowed to use the ICQ Number contact field.

setting.name: allowskypefield
setting.title: Allow Skype ID Field To Usergroups
setting.description: Select the usergroups which should be allowed to use the Skype ID contact field.

setting.name: allowgooglefield
setting.title: Allow Google Hangouts ID Field To Usergroups
setting.description: Select the usergroups which should be allowed to use the Google Hangouts ID contact field.

settinggroup.name: statspage
settinggroup.title: Statistics Page
settinggroup.description: This section allows you to change the settings of the statistics page.

setting.name: statsenabled
setting.title: Enable Statistics Pages
setting.description: If you wish to disable the statistics page on your board, set this option to No.

setting.name: statscachetime
setting.title: Statistics Cache Time
setting.description: Insert the interval of time to refresh the statistics page cache (in hours). Set to 0 to disable caching.

setting.name: statslimit
setting.title: Stats Limit
setting.description: The number of threads to show on the stats page for most replies and most views. Set to 0 to disable.

setting.name: statstopreferrer
setting.title: Show Top Referrer on Statistics Page
setting.description: Do you want to show the top referrer on the stats.php page? This adds an additional query.

settinggroup.name: forumteam
settinggroup.title: Forum Team
settinggroup.description: This section allows you to control various aspects of the forum team listing (showteam.php), such as aspects to consider while listing team members, and which features to enable or disable.

setting.name: enableshowteam
setting.title: Enable Forum Team Listing Functionality
setting.description: If you wish to disable the forum team listing on your board, set this option to No.

setting.name: showaddlgroups
setting.title: Show Additional Groups
setting.description: Whether the team list will populate considering additional groups as well.

setting.name: showgroupleaders
setting.title: Show Group Leaders
setting.description: Include group leaders to show up in the team list.
